main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects in Camden, New Jersey in 1957, including a glowing bell-shaped object observed by a civilian and a silvery, glowing object observed by a U.S. Navy employee.
interesting points: The glowing bell-shaped object was observed to climb and then dip out of sight, with no evidence of trail, vapor, or sound.
An examination of the negatives of a photograph mentioned in the report concluded that it may have been a time exposure and the object's movement was likely caused by camera movement.
The size of the observed objects was estimated to be around 4-5" and 2-3" when it disappeared, and they were not picked up by local radar installations.

A civilian carpenter employed by the U.S. Navy reported observing the object almost every day for the past week, and also expressed a belief that the objects would land in the future and make personal contact.

The weather conditions described during the sightings included hazy visibility and light winds, and records contained no information concerning meteorological activities that could account for the sightings.
sighted object: glowing bell-shaped object, silvery, glowing object
